channel.title: :tradereq: but not s.endsWith [CLIENT SIDE]

item.title: :tradereq: but not s.endsWith [CLIENT SIDE]
item.dc:creator: @jonaske jonaske
item.description:
@jonaske wrote:

I’ve in client.java SERVER SIDE:

sendMessage(playerName+":tradereq:");

but i want it like this:

 sendMessage(playerName+":tradereq:"+id);

and int id = 1; (for example)

but when i try this i get: name:tradereq:1
but i want it so it does: name wishes to trade you 1
Well how do i make it so ?

i’ve this: CLIENT side

[CODE]if(s.endsWith(":tradereq:"))
{
String s3 = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(":"));
long l17 = Class50.method583(s3);
boolean flag2 = false;
for(int j27 = 0; j27 < anInt822; j27++)
{
if(aLongArray925[j27] != l17)
continue;
flag2 = true;
break;
}

                if(!flag2 && anInt1251 == 0)
                    method77("wishes to trade with you.", 4, s3, aBoolean991);
            }[/CODE]

but in what i’ve to change s.endsWith ?

jonas
